DataElement.preferredName: Person Serum Potassium Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded yes/no/not applicable indicator regarding whether a person has a lower serum potassium level, a metallic element that is important in body functions such as regulation of blood pressure and of water content in cells, transmission of nerve impulses, digestion, muscle contraction, and heartbeat, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Serum Potassium Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person's serum potassium level, a metallic element that is important in body functions such as regulation of blood pressure and of water content in cells, transmission of nerve impulses, digestion, muscle contraction, and heartbeat.as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Serum Potassium Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:An element with atomic symbol K, atomic number 19, and atomic weight 39.10.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
An element with atomic symbol K, atomic number 19, and atomic weight 39.10.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Is pre-study serum potassium
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study serum potassium less than 3.5 mmol/L (potassium supplementation may be given to restore the serum potassium above this level prior to study entry)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Potassium is greater than or equal to the lower limit of normal (per institutional limits)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study potassium within the normal institutional range?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study potassium greater than 3 and less than 5.5 mEq/L?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study potassium greater than lower limit of normal?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is pre-study potassium greater than or equal to the lower limit of normal?
